hopobject.name: symbian
hopobject.http_browser: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; en-US; rv:1.9.2) Gecko/20100115 Firefox/3.6
hopobject.body:
Symbian is the world's most widely used smartphone operating system with over 300 million devices sold. Since February 2010 it is fully open source under the EPL license and the Beagleboard is the reference hardware platform.

Symbian is governed by the independent Symbian Foundation and developed by our community, including Nokia, Sony Ericsson, NTT DoCoMo and many smaller companies and individuals.

We encourage our community to help out completing the Beagleboard port. To get started we recommend the Wild Ducks project which aims to provide a complete open smartphone platform based on the Beagleboard.
hopobject.shortdesc: Symbian is the world's most widely used smartphone operating system with over 300 million devices sold. Since February 2010 it is fully open source under the EPL license and the Beagleboard is the reference hardware platform.
